value.title: From the Data and AI Expert Labs: Invest in teams, not just technology

value.title: Zeni raises $13.5M to automate bookkeeping with AI
value.excerpt: Zeni, a startup providing AI-powered financial services management to startups, has raised $13.5 million in funding.

value.title: VMware and Nvidia launch GPU virtualization platform for enterprises
value.excerpt: VMware and Nvidia deliver on promise to enable GPUs to run multiple workloads using VMware vSphere virtual machine software.

value.title: Ibex Medical Analytics raises $38M for its AI-powered cancer diagnostic platform
value.excerpt: Israel-based Ibex Medical Analytics, which has an AI-driven imaging technology to detect cancer cells in biopsies more efficiently, has raised a $38 million Series B financing round led by Octopus Ventures and 83North.

value.title: Are U.S. Special Forces Quietly Using Armed Robots?
value.excerpt: While the U.S. military makes wide use of armed drones, it has been extremely cautious when it comes to fielding weaponized ground robots. Now Special Forces may have quietly crossed the line by deploying a new system.

value.title: There's no real AI revolution without ethics
value.excerpt: Tonya Hall interviews Matthew Bailey, author and CEO at AIEthics.World, about what governments and regulators need to do for AI to really benefit humankind.

value.title: GPU and Machine Learning Identify Spots on DNA That Are Likely to Mutate

value.title: KPMG: AI adoption accelerated too fast during the pandemic
value.excerpt: The outlook for artificial intelligence is optimistic under the Biden administration, but executives want industry regulation, a survey finds.

value.title: Waymo simulated real-world crashes to prove its self-driving cars can prevent deaths
value.excerpt: In a bid to prove that its robot drivers are safer than humans, Waymo simulated dozens of real-world fatal crashes that took place in Arizona over nearly a decade. value.title: The amazing promise of artificial intelligence in health care
value.excerpt: Artificial intelligence can already scan images of the eye to assess patients for diabetic retinopathy, a leading cause of vision loss, and to find evidence of strokes on brain CT scans. But what does the future hold for this emerging technology?

value.title: Here's How Befitting Uses AI to Help You Buy the Right Prescription Glasses Online
value.excerpt: It's as easy as using a dating app, but instead of matching with a date, you get matched with the perfect pair of frames. Here's how Befitting can help you find your next pair of glasses online.

value.title: Debate over accuracy of AI transcription services rages on
value.excerpt: An absence of natural language benchmarks makes it difficult to assess accuracy of competing automated speech recognition (ASR) platforms.

value.title: Underpaid Workers Are Being Forced To Train Biased AI on Mechanical Turk
value.excerpt: Workers who label images on platforms like Mechanical Turk say they are being incentivized to fall in line with their responses—or risk losing work.

value.title: Algorithm helps artificial intelligence systems dodge “adversarial” inputs
value.excerpt: A deep-learning algorithm developed by MIT researchers is designed to help machines navigate in the real world, where imperfect or “adversarial” inputs may cause uncertainty.

value.title: Assessing regulatory fairness through machine learning
value.excerpt: Applying machine learning to a U.S. Environmental Protection Agency initiative reveals how key design elements determine what communities bear the burden of pollution. The approach could help ensure fairness and accountability in machine learning used by government regulators.

value.title: Last-mile delivery robotics company Refraction AI raises $4.2M

value.title: Research explores promoting public trust in AI
value.excerpt: The public doesn't need to know how Artificial Intelligence works to trust it. They just need to know that someone with the necessary skillset is examining AI and has the authority to mete out sanctions if it causes or is likely to cause harm.

value.title: Google employee group urges Congress to strengthen whistleblower protections for AI researchers
value.excerpt: A Google employee group wants Congress and state legislatures to strengthen whistleblower protection laws for AI ethics researchers.
